meanings.definition: The quality of lacking persuasiveness or credibility.
meanings.sent1: Her argument's unconvincingness made it hard to believe.
meanings.sent2: The unconvincingness of the sales pitch failed to persuade anyone.
meanings.sent3: The unconvincingness of the excuse was so obvious, it almost made us laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unconvincingness of his acting was like watching a bad play.
meanings.sent5: The unconvincingness of the conspiracy theory left everyone skeptical.

meanings.definition: The state of being unconvincing or not believable.
meanings.sent1: The movie's unconvincingness made it hard to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't ignore the unconvincingness of his alibi.
meanings.sent3: The unconvincingness of the magic trick revealed the secret behind it.
meanings.sent4: The unconvincingness of his promises was like a house of cards.
meanings.sent5: The unconvincingness of the ghost story left everyone unimpressed.
